workflowExecutionState.description: Current state of the workflow execution.

status.description: Current status/result of the workflow execution.

statusOverrideAt.description: Timestamp when the status override occurred.

statusOverrideRequestId.description: Request ID associated with the status override.

statusOverrideBy.description: Identifier of the user who performed the status override.

riskAssessment.description: Risk assessment for the workflow execution.

isManual.description: Indicates if the workflow was executed manually.

steps.description: Steps executed as part of the workflow.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the workflow execution started.

endedAt.description: The timestamp when the workflow execution ended.

issues.description: List of issues encountered during the workflow execution.

lifecyclePhase.description: Current lifecycle phase of the workflow.

monitoringTypes.description: The types of monitoring that subscribe to the workflow.

serviceProfileId.description: The unique identifier of the service profile.

status.description: Indicates whether the subscription is currently active and operational.

workflowName.description: The name of the monitoring workflow executed when a monitoring alert occurs.

workflowId.description: The unique identifier of the monitoring workflow.

enabledAt.description: The date and time when the subscription was most recently enabled.

enabledRequestId.description: The request identifier for the most recent enable action.

enabledBy.description: The user who most recently enabled the subscription.

disabledAt.description: The date and time when the subscription was most recently disabled.

disabledRequestId.description: The request identifier for the most recent disable action.

disabledBy.description: The user who most recently disabled the subscription.

serviceProfileId.description: The unique identifier for the service profile.

latestRiskAssessmentId.description:
The ID of the latest risk assessment in the most recent workflow with a valid assessment.
Omitted if no valid risk assessment exists.

latestWorkflowExecutionId.description:
The ID of the most recent workflow execution.
Omitted if no workflows exist.

country.description: The ISO 3166 alpha-3 code representing the individual's country of residence or the business's country of registration.

schemaVersion.description: The version number of the schema.

createdAt.description: The UTC date and time when this service profile was created.

createdRequestId.description: The unique ULID identifier of the request that created this service profile.

createdBy.description: The user or client that created this profile.

updatedAt.description: The UTC date and time when this service profile was last updated, if applicable.

updatedBy.description: The user or client that last updated this profile.

updatedRequestId.description: The unique ULID identifier of the request that last updated this service profile.

assignee.description: The name of the officer assigned to approve this profile.

reviewer.description: The name of the officer assigned to review this profile.

currentWorkflowName.description: The name of the current workflow, if applicable.

serviceName.description: The name of the service associated with this profile.

subscriptions.description:
The list of subscriptions associated with the service profile.
A subscription determines if the service profile is subscribed to a particular ongoing process.

Service-Profile-State.description:
Current state of the Service Profile
- INIT: Initial state when the profile is created.
- AUTO: Automatically assigned state, typically after initial processing.
- ACTIVE: The profile is active and in use.
- ARCHIVED: The profile has been archived and is no longer active.
- BLOCKLISTED: The profile is blocked from further actions.
- INACTIVE: The profile is inactive, not currently in use.
- DELETED: The profile has been deleted.
- DUPLICATE: The profile is a duplicate of another existing profile.

Request-ID.description: The unique request identifier for the API call made.

issueLocation.description: The location or context where the issue was identified.

issueType.description: The type or category of the issue.

400.errorMsg: Parsing credentials from "<invalid>" failed, because invalid.

name.description: Name of the step (must be unique)

dependsOn.description: List of step names that this step depends on

definitionUpdatedAt.description: The date and time the workflow was last updated

workflowDisplayName.description: The display name for the workflow. This field is optional, when the value exists workflow name displayed in portal will be the value of this field.

monitoringTypes.description:
The types of monitoring to which this workflow is subscribed.
If not provided, the workflow is subscribed to all monitoring types.

Workflow-Execution-ObjectTypeEnum.description:
The type of primary object that was checked. Either:
- NAME
- ADDRESS
- DATE_OF_BIRTH
- ORGANIZATION
- DOCUMENT
- EMAIL_ADDRESS
- PHONE_NUMBER
- DEVICE
- INDIVIDUAL

result.description: Result or status returned by the provider.

order.description: Sequence order of the provider in the process.

startedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the provider started.

endedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the provider ended.

Workflow-Step-ResultEnum.description:
Overall result of the workflow step.

Depending on the context of the step and its purpose, it will return a different result code:
  - UNCHECKED: Step was not attempted. There will be an error or suitable message indicating why, most likely due to a failure in a previous step.
  - SKIPPED: Step was skipped as it was not required to run, or had previously been run and the existing results are sufficient.
  - MISSING_DATA: Step requires additional data before it can complete. Details should be in the error objects.
  - PASS: The step completed and requested goals were met. Usually manually applied or where the result is binary.
  - FAIL: The step completed but the requested goals were not met. Usually manually applied or where the result is binary.
  - COMPLETE: The step has finished successfully and there is not necessarily a pass/fail scenario, just that the process needed to be done.
  - INCOMPLETE: The step was unable to finish successfully and there is not necessarily a pass/fail scenario, just that the process needed to be done and was not.
  - MATCH: The results of this step produced a fully successful match against the requested source(s).
  - NO_MATCH: The results of this step produced no match against the requested source(s).
  - PARTIAL: The results of this step produced a partially successful match against the requested source(s).
  - CLEAR: The step involved checking against a list/source (generally negative in nature) and no match was found (a positive outcome).
  - HIT: The step involved checking against a list/source (generally negative in nature) and a match of some kind was found.
  - CLEARED: The step involved checking against a list/source (generally negative in nature) and, while there were previously found matches, these have been resolved.
  - EXPIRED: The data found in this step has expired in some way.
  - CLEAR_REVIEW: The step was cleared but requires review.
  - HIT_ACCEPTED: A hit was found and accepted.
  - HIT_REJECTED: A hit was found and rejected.
  - NOT_APPLICABLE: The step attempted to run, but it was determined to be unnecessary (e.g., checking for a visa when already a citizen).
  - ERROR: The step attempted to run, but there was an unrecoverable error and no useful result can be determined.

location.description: Location or context where the error occurred.

objectId.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the name, address, date of birth, or other object that was verified.

objectType.description: The type of object, such as current address (curr_addr), current name (curr_name), previous name (prev_name), alternate date of birth (alt_dob), or passport (PASSPORT).

matchCount.description: Number of distinct matches for this match type.

nonMatchSources.description: List of sources that did not match, if available from the service provider.

isChecked.description: Indicates whether an attempt was made to verify.

isVerified.description: Indicates whether there is at least one match.

provider.description: The name of the provider that returned the result.

source.description: The source within the provider that returned the result.

attributesMatched.description: List of attributes that were matched.

Workflow-Step-Summary-KYC-MatchRule-Matc.description: Summary of all KYC matches for a given set of criteria.

matchCount.description: Total number of matches for this set of match types (i.e., the sum of the matchCounts in the matchTypes map).

matchCountRequired.description: Number of distinct matches required for this set of match types.

hasAllRequiredSourcesMatched.description: Indicates whether all required match sources (e.g., electoral roll) have matched.

requiredSourcesMatched.description: List of required sources that resulted in a match.

requiredSourcesNotMatched.description: List of required sources that did not result in a match.

isVerified.description: Indicates whether there are enough matches to meet the matching requirement.

Workflow-Step-Summary-KYC-MatchRule.description:
Provides the details of a KYC matching rule result.
The details can be used to represent a rule that did match or did not match.
By default, there will always be one matching rule record provided at the end of a KYC step.

ruleName.description: The name assigned to this rule.

ruleOrder.description: The priority order of this matching rule.

ruleMatches.description: The list of matches that comprise this rule.

Workflow-Step-Summary-KYC.description: Captures the overall summary of the KYC step, including which matches have been made, with which sources, and under which ruleset.

matchedRules.description: List of KYC rulesets that have matched, along with a summary of those matches.

unmatchedRules.description: List of KYC rulesets that did not have sufficient results to be considered a match.

Workflow-Step-Summary-AML-Search-Paramet.description: Search query parameters used in the AML workflow step.

name.description: Name sent to the service provider, if provided as a single string.

givenName.description: Given name sent to the service provider.

otherName.description: Other name sent to the service provider.

familyName.description: Family name sent to the service provider.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth sent to the service provider. May be in any format and may be a partial date.

address.description: Main address sent to the service provider.

gender.description: Gender sent to the service provider.

nationality.description: Nationality sent to the service provider.

idNumber.description: ID number sent to the service provider.

idType.description: ID type sent to the service provider.

idCountry.description: ID country sent to the service provider.

placeOfBirth.description: Place of birth sent to the service provider.

placeOfResidence.description: Place of residence sent to the service provider.

fuzziness.description: Search fuzziness level; may be a percentage or a descriptive level.

Workflow-Step-Summary-AML-ProviderSummar.description: Summary of individual provider results for AML checks.

lastRetrievedAt.description: The date and time this data was last retrieved from the provider. An earlier date may indicate previously retrieved data.

numHits.description: Total number of AML hits from this provider.

numFalsePositives.description: Total number of AML hits marked as false positive from this provider.

numTruePositives.description: Total number of AML hits marked as true positive from this provider.

numUnknown.description: Total number of AML hits marked as unknown from this provider.

numUnresolved.description: Total number of AML hits that remain unresolved from this provider.

items.description: ISO-3166-alpha3 country code where PEP hits were found.
ISO-3166-alpha3 country code where sanction hits were found.
ISO-3166-alpha3 country code where watchlist hits were found.
ISO-3166-alpha3 country code where adverse media hits were found.

numUnresolvedPEP.description: Total number of AML hits with unresolved PEP entries from this provider.

numUnresolvedSanction.description: Total number of AML hits with unresolved sanction entries from this provider.

numUnresolvedWatchlist.description: Total number of AML hits with unresolved watchlist entries from this provider.

numUnresolvedAdverseMedia.description: Total number of AML hits with unresolved adverse media entries from this provider.

Workflow-Step-Summary-AML.description: Provides details of the overall AML (Anti-Money Laundering) step results.

totalHits.description: Total number of AML hits across all providers.

totalFalsePositives.description: Total number of AML hits marked as false positive across all providers.

totalTruePositives.description: Total number of AML hits marked as true positive across all providers.

totalUnknown.description: Total number of AML hits marked as unknown across all providers.

totalUnresolved.description: Total number of AML hits that remain unresolved across all providers.

numUnresolvedPEP.description: Total number of unresolved AML hits with a PEP (Politically Exposed Person) entry across all providers.

numUnresolvedSanction.description: Total number of unresolved AML hits with a sanctions entry across all providers.

numUnresolvedWatchlist.description: Total number of unresolved AML hits with a watchlist entry across all providers.

numUnresolvedAdverseMedia.description: Total number of unresolved AML hits with an adverse media entry across all providers.

providerSummaries.description: Summary of each provider's AML results.

objectType.description: The type of object, such as curr_addr, curr_name, prev_name, alt_dob, or PASSPORT.

matchCount.description: Number of distinct matches for this match type.

nonMatchSources.description: List of sources that did not match, if available from the service provider.

isChecked.description: Indicates if an attempt was made to verify.

isVerified.description: Indicates if there is at least one match.

matchCount.description: Number of matches for this set of match types. This is the sum of the matchCounts in the matchTypes map.

matchCountRequired.description: Number of distinct matches required for this set of match types.

hasAllRequiredSourcesMatched.description: True if all required match sources (e.g., electoral roll) were matched.

requiredSourcesMatched.description: List of required sources that were matched.

requiredSourcesNotMatched.description: List of required sources that were not matched.

isVerified.description: True if there are enough matches to meet the matching requirement.

Workflow-Step-Summary-Visa.description:
Provides details of the visa as returned from VEVO.
Class and subclass values can be found on the VEVO website.

hasExpired.description: Indicates if the visa has expired (sometimes expiry date is not returned).

noExpiry.description: Indicates if this visa has no expiry.

onAllowList.description: Indicates if this class/subclass is on the allow list, if an allow list is set.

onDenyList.description: Indicates if this class/subclass is on the deny list, if a deny list is set.

Workflow-Step-Summary-NameValidation.description: Provides summary details for the name validation step.

nameMatchOrder.description:
Depending on the name to be translated and how it is presented, the native language and anglicized version ordering might be mixed up. The service will try various orderings to determine if a match can be made.
The order codes represent the actual order that matched.
Each letter combination represents *F*amily, *G*iven, and *O*ther names.
For example, FGO means that the match was on Family, Given, and Other names, in that order.

Matchlist-Action.description:
Default action recommended for a match. The action can be one of the following:
  - `BLOCK`: Recommended action is to block the entity.
  - `ALERT`: Recommended action is to create an alert for the entity.
  - `ALLOW`: Recommended action is to allow the entity.
  - `REVIEW`: Recommended action is to review the entity.
  - `NONE`: No action; only use the `riskFactor` if any.

numMatches.description: Total number of matches from this matchlist.

numFalsePositives.description: Total number of matches from this matchlist that are marked as false positives.

numTruePositives.description: Total number of matches from this matchlist that are marked as true positives.

numUnknown.description: Total number of matches from this matchlist that are marked as unknown.

numUnresolved.description: Total number of matches from this matchlist that are yet to be classified.

Workflow-Step-Summary-Matchlist.description: Provides a summary of all matchlist screening results for a workflow step.

totalMatches.description: Total number of matches identified across all matchlists.

totalFalsePositives.description: Total number of matches across all matchlists that have been marked as false positives.

totalTruePositives.description: Total number of matches across all matchlists that have been marked as true positives.

totalUnknown.description: Total number of matches across all matchlists that have been marked as unknown.

totalUnresolved.description: Total number of matches across all matchlists that are yet to be classified.

matchlistSummaries.description: A summary of each provider's matchlist screening results.

Workflow-Step-Summary-Duplicate.description: Provides details of the overall duplicate step results.

totalDuplicates.description: Total number of duplicate hits found.

totalFalsePositives.description: Total number of duplicates marked as false positive.

totalTruePositives.description: Total number of duplicates marked as true positive.

totalUnresolved.description: Total number of duplicate hits that are not yet resolved.

totalResolved.description: Total number of duplicate hits that are already resolved.

Workflow-Step-Summary-Activity-Monitor.description: Provides details of the overall activity monitoring step results

amlActivityCount.description:
Count of AML activity alerts. Includes all AML alerts with status IN_REVIEW or NULL.
Excludes false positives and true positives.

amlActivityTruePositiveCount.description: Count of true positive AML activity alerts.

fraudActivityCount.description:
Count of Fraud activity alerts. Includes all Fraud alerts with status IN_REVIEW or NULL.
Excludes false positives and true positives.

fraudActivityTruePositiveCount.description: Count of true positive Fraud activity alerts.

eventActivityCount.description:
Count of Behaviour activity alerts. Includes all Event alerts with status IN_REVIEW or NULL.
Excludes false positives and true positives.

eventActivityTruePositiveCount.description: Count of true positive Behaviour activity alerts.

Workflow-Step-Summary-Fraud.description: Provides details of the overall Fraud step results.

numberEmailAddressEvaluations.description: Total number of email address evaluations.

numberPhoneNumberEvaluations.description: Total number of phone number evaluations.

numberSessionsNotEvaluated.description:
Total number of sessions not evaluated.

This value is greater than 0 when there are too many sessions to reasonably evaluate.

Workflow-Step-Summary-SupportDoc.description: Provides summary details for the supporting document step.

Workflow-Step-Risk-Result-Value.description: Raw value and score from evaluated risk factor

value.description: raw value from evaluated risk factor

score.description: score of the raw value from evaluated risk factor

Workflow-Step-Risk-Result-Detail.description: Details of a calculated risk result for a workflow step.

factor.description: Name of the risk factor contributing to this score.

value.description: Value used for the score factor.

matchedRule.description: description of the specific rule or range that was matched

source.description: JSON path to the specific field in the entity object that provided the data for the evaluation

inputsConsidered.description: List of raw values and their individual scores

Workflow-Step-Risk-Result.description: Calculated risk result for a workflow step.

contributedScore.description: Risk score contributed by this step.

normalized.description:
The normalized fuzziness level, if set.
Note: This is a normalized value, NOT the one used by the service provider (see the "actual" field).
Assumes a scale of 0.0 (exact match) to 100.0 (match anything).

actual.description:
The actual fuzziness level as provided by the service provider, if set.
Note: This is not a normalized value, but the original value from the provider.

normalized.description:
The normalized confidence level, if set.
Note: This is a normalized value, NOT the one used by the service provider (see the "actual" field).
Assumes a scale of 0.0 (exact match) to 100.0 (match anything).

actual.description:
The actual confidence level as provided by the service provider, if set.
Note: This is not a normalized value, but the original value from the provider.

Process-ResultEnum.description:
The actual pass/fail result of the element check
- MATCH: The element check matched the expected criteria.
- PARTIAL_MATCH: The element check partially matched the expected criteria.
- INVALID_MATCH: The element check matched but was invalid.
- NO_MATCH: The element check did not match the expected criteria.
- CLEAR: The element check was cleared.
- HIT: The element check hit a specific condition or threshold.
- BAD_DATA: The element check encountered bad data.
- CREATED: The element check resulted in the creation of a new record.
- UPDATED: The element check resulted in the update of an existing record.
- DELETED: The element check resulted in the deletion of a record.
- FAIL: The element check failed.
- NOT_APPLICABLE: The element check was not applicable in the given context.
- SUSPECTED: The element check raised a suspicion but did not confirm it.
- REJECTED: The element check was rejected.
- MANUAL: The element check was manually reviewed or processed.
- CLEAR_AUTO: The element check was cleared automatically.
- OVERRIDE: The element check was overridden by a manual action or system rule.

Process-Result-ClassEnum.description: Provides additional clarity for the result class, especially for more generic element types like 'person'.

type.description:
The type of supplementary data. Possible values:
  - AML
  - KYC_ADDRESS
  - KYC_DOB
  - KYC_GENDER
  - KYC_NAME
  - ID
  - VISA
  - NAME_VALIDATION
  - KYB_ORGANIZATION
  - MATCHLIST
  - DUPLICATE
  - FRAUD_DEVICE
  - FRAUD_EMAIL
  - FRAUD_PHONE
  - FRAUD_LOOKUP
  - ACTIVITY_AML
  - ACTIVITY_EVENT
  - ACTIVITY_FRAUD

Supplementary-Data-AML-MatchData-Country.description: Represents the country code and match type for an AML (Anti-Money Laundering) country match.

code.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code where a match was identified.

matchType.description:
The type of match associated with this country. Possible values include:
  - CITIZENSHIP
  - RESIDENCE
  - BIRTH
  - NATIONALITY
  - INCORPORATION (for organizations)
  - OPERATION

Supplementary-Data-AML-MatchData-Nationa.description: Provides details of a matched identification document, if supplied.

idType.description: The type of identification matched (e.g., National ID, passport).

idExpiry.description: The expiry date of the identification document (if known), using the format provided by the service provider.

issuingCountryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code of the issuing country.

documentId.description: The document ID if this was matched to a FrankieOne document record.

Supplementary-Data-AML-MatchData.description: Contains information about this specific matched entity.

strength.description: The confidence level of the match as determined by the service provider, expressed as a percentage from 0 to 100. Can be a decimal value (e.g., 85.7).

spReferenceId.description: The internal identifier assigned by the service provider for the matched individual or business.

name.description: The name matched by the service provider.

givenName.description: The given name matched by the service provider (optional).

otherName.description: The middle or other name(s) matched by the service provider (optional).

familyName.description: The family name matched by the service provider (optional).

date.description: The date matched in the system, formatted as provided by the service provider. May be only a year.

address.description: The address matched by the service provider (optional).

imageUrl.description: A URL to a displayable image of the matched individual or company logo.

isDeceased.description: Indicates if this match is to a deceased individual.

isAlias.description: Indicates if this match is an alias of the searched individual or organization.

isRelated.description: Indicates if this match is a related party of the searched individual or organization.

Supplementary-Data-AML-RelatedParties.description: Defines the name and relationship of individuals or organizations related to the matched entity.

name.description: The name of the related individual or organization.

relationship.description:
The nature of the relationship to the matched entity.
For example: "Sibling", "Director", "Known associate".

Supplementary-Data-AML-ReferenceDocs.description: Captures references to source documents or websites, including the URL and, where available, a description of the original source.

url.description: URL of any external reference document related to this matched entity.

description.description: If a description of the document is provided, it will be included here.

Supplementary-Data-AML-AdditionalData.description: Represents a simple key-value pair for AML data to capture any additional information not included in the main object.

key.description: The key name, formatted in snake_case (e.g., key_in_snake_case), which can be converted to spaced title case for display.

value.description: The value associated with the key, provided as a string for display purposes.

Supplementary-Data-AML-PEPData.description: Contains Politically Exposed Person (PEP) information about a specific matched entity.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code where the PEP entry was recorded.

countryName.description: The ISO 3166 country name where the PEP entry was recorded.

sourceName.description: The source of the PEP entry data.

level.description: The PEP "level", generally represented by a number from 1 (heads of state, military, civil service, etc.) to 4 (local government, minor public servants, etc.).

sourceUrl.description: The URL where the original PEP information can be found.

sourcePosition.description: (Deprecated) The position held that created the PEP entry.

position.description: The position held that created the PEP entry.

positionDescription.description: A description of the position held that created the PEP entry.

listingStart.description: The date when the listing started. Will attempt to use ISO 8601 date format; otherwise, the format supplied by the source.

listingEnd.description: The date when the listing ended (if available or known). Will attempt to use ISO 8601 date format; otherwise, the format supplied by the source.

imageUrl.description: Optional URL of an image of the person associated with their role.

Supplementary-Data-AML-SanctionsData.description: Contains sanction information about a specific matched entity.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code where the sanction entry was recorded.

countryName.description: The ISO 3166 country name where the sanction entry was recorded.

sourceName.description: The source of the sanction entry data.

sourceUrl.description: The URL where the original sanction information can be found.

sourceReason.description: The reason provided for sanctioning the individual or organization.

listingStart.description: The date when the listing started. Will attempt to use ISO 8601 date format; otherwise, the format supplied by the source.

listingEnd.description: The date when the listing ended (if available or known). Will attempt to use ISO 8601 date format; otherwise, the format supplied by the source.

imageUrl.description: Optional URL of an image of the person or company logo of the sanctioned entity.

Supplementary-Data-AML-WatchlistData.description: Contains non-PEP/non-sanction watchlist and other source information about a specific matched entity.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code where the watchlist entry was recorded.

countryName.description: The ISO 3166 country name where the watchlist entry was recorded.

sourceName.description: The source of the watchlist entry data.

sourceUrl.description: The URL where the original watchlist information can be found.

sourceReason.description: The reason provided for adding the individual or organization to the watchlist.

listingStart.description: The date when the listing started. Will attempt to use ISO 8601 date format; otherwise, the format supplied by the source.

listingEnd.description: The date when the listing ended (if available or known). Will attempt to use ISO 8601 date format; otherwise, the format supplied by the source.

imageUrl.description: Optional URL of an image of the person or company logo of the entity on this list.

Supplementary-Data-AML-MediaData.description: Contains adverse media information about a specific matched entity.

title.description: The title of the article or media source.

snippet.description: A short excerpt or snippet from the article.

source.description: The source or publisher of the article or media.

sourceDate.description: The publication date, as referenced and formatted by the source.

sourceCountry.description: The country of origin for the article, if available.

url.description: The URL to the original full article, if available.

isCurrent.description: Indicates whether this article is still considered current.

Supplementary-Data-AML.description: Each AML match/hit generates a PRO, and this object describes the details of the matched individual or business.

serviceProvider.description: The name of the service provider from which this matched record was retrieved.

searchId.description: The service provider's search reference number, usually used to refer to an ongoing search.

caseId.description: If the service provider has case management facilities, this is their case identifier. May be the same as the search ID.

referenceId.description: An additional reference number provided by the service provider, or our own reference number.

originalStepSearchLevel.description: Indicates if this was a simple PEP or PEP media check that found this match. Used to determine if more information is needed when re-using existing results.

groupingId.description: Some matches can be grouped together as part of a collection of searches. This can be the searchId or a reference ID.

reportUrl.description: If the service provider supplies a pre-packaged report that can be downloaded independently, this is the URL to retrieve it.

items.description: Alternative names, aliases, "AKA"s, or names as spelled in other languages, etc.

Supplementary-Data-KYC-Address.description:
Defines the matching levels for each address element, where available.
Provides a match strength score ranging from 0 (no match) to 100 (full match).

wasNameMatchStrongEnough.description:
Indicates whether there was a sufficiently strong name match at the time this was checked, even if the address was a perfect match.
This is only an indicator at the time the PRO was created. Subsequent checks that reuse this result may interpret this differently.

Supplementary-Data-KYC-DoB.description:
Defines the matching levels for each date of birth element, where available.
Provides a match strength score ranging from 0 (no match) to 100 (full match).

wasNameMatchStrongEnough.description:
Indicates whether there was a sufficiently strong name match at the time this was checked, even if the date of birth was a perfect match.
This is only an indicator at the time the PRO was created. Subsequent checks that reuse this result may interpret this differently.

Supplementary-Data-KYC-Gender.description: Defines the matching results for a gender check. This is rarely used.

wasNameMatchStrongEnough.description:
Indicates whether there was a sufficiently strong name match at the time this was checked, even if the gender was a perfect match.
This is only an indicator at the time the PRO was created. Subsequent checks that reuse this result may interpret this differently.

Supplementary-Data-KYC-Name.description:
Defines the matching levels for each name element, where available.
Provides a match strength score ranging from 0 (no match) to 100 (full match).

name.description:
If the name verification result is known, record it here.

NOTE: This should not be used as a KYC result; informational only.
Please use a separate PRO for an actual KYC result if required.

dateOfBirth.description:
If the date of birth verification result is known, record it here.

NOTE: This should not be used as a KYC result; informational only.
Please use a separate PRO for an actual KYC result if required.

isValid.description: Indicates if the ID is valid (if known).

isExpired.description: Indicates if the ID has expired (if known).

isBlocked.description: Indicates if the ID has been blocked at the source.

blockingCode.description: If the service provider returns a blocking code or reason, it will be recorded here.

attachmentId.description: If a photo was sent to the service provider, the FrankieOne scanId is added for reference.

photoId.description: If a photo was supplied and checked, the match score is recorded here.

photoIssue.description: If there was an issue checking the photo, any error details can be found here.

Supplementary-Data-ID.description:
Provides the matching levels found for each ID element, where available.
Match strength is scaled from 0 (no match) to 100 (full match).

Supplementary-Data-Visa.description:
Defines the Visa details returned from VEVO.
Class and subclass values can be found on the VEVO website.

hasExpired.description: Indicates if the visa has expired (sometimes expiry date is not returned).

noExpiry.description: Indicates if this visa has no expiry.

holderType.description:
Indicates if this is the primary visa holder or a secondary holder (usually a spouse/partner or other family member).
Values:
  - PRIMARY
  - SECONDARY

lookupErrorCode.description: If there was an error during the lookup, this is the code returned from VEVO.

Supplementary-Data-NameValidation.description: Details on how the native language name was verified against a dictionary of anglicized translations.

nameMatchOrder.description:
Depending on the name to be translated and how it is presented, the native language and anglicized version ordering might be mixed up. The service will try various orderings to find a match.
The order codes represent the actual order that matched.
Each letter combination represents *F*amily, *G*iven, and *O*ther names.
For example, FGO means that Family, Given, and Other names matched in that order.

Supplementary-Data-KYB-Organization.description:
Defines OQRO (Ownership Query Result Object) at various stages in the KYB (Know Your Business) flow.
The 'oqro' property temporarily stores the V1 OQRO and will be used until the V2 OQRO is defined.

organization.description: V2 OQRO; to be defined in the future.

Object-Type.description: The type of object being annotated.

Supplementary-Data-Base-MatchStrength.description:
Represents the standard match strength, scaled from 0 (no match) to 100 (exact match).
In some cases, a value of 50 may be interpreted as a "partial" match.

Supplementary-Data-Duplicate-MatchField.description: Provides details of a match between entities, the objects they represent, and the match strength.

duplicateObjectId.description: The ID of the object that was found to be a duplicate.

objectId.description: The ID of the object that originated the match.

Supplementary-Data-Duplicate-MatchedRule.description: Provides details about the rule that was matched to classify the object as a duplicate.

name.description: The name of the matched rule.

strength.description:
The strength of the match. This is free-form, but it is recommended to use standard values for clarity, such as:
  - "VERY_LOW"
  - "LOW"
  - "MEDIUM"
  - "HIGH"
  - "VERY_HIGH"

Supplementary-Data-Duplicate.description: Provides details of a single duplicate match, including the matching entity ID and a list of matched elements.

duplicateEntityId.description: The entity ID of the entity that was matched by the matched fields.

matchedFields.description: The list of fields that determined this is a duplicate of another entity.

matchedRules.description: The list of rules that were matched to determine this is a duplicate of another entity.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-Data.description: Contains information about a specific matched IDV element.

originalName.description: The name of the element as returned by the provider, before normalization (e.g., 'face', 'dob', 'name').

confidence.description: Service provider's confidence in this value.

confidenceThreshold.description: Configured confidence threshold for this value to be considered valid.

originalData.description: The raw data returned by the provider.

reviewedData.description: If the applicant was given a chance to correct the data, this is the reviewed data with any changes.

resultNormalized.description: The final result after applying confidence and normalization (e.g., clear, suspected, rejected).

description.description: A description of the data element returned in the rawData field.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-ElementMap.description:
A map of IDV report elements obtained from the requested IDV service provider.

The map keys are arbitrary strings, but where possible, should use a value from the predefined IDV Data Enums.
Service provider connections should map supplied values to existing enums where possible.
If there is no relevant existing match, it is acceptable to use the original service provider value as the key.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-Base.description: A report from an IDV provider based on a photographic or video biometrics process.

outcomeRaw.description: The original outcome of the IDV process, as reported by the service provider.

requiredElements.description: List of elements required to have passed, as per the step configuration.

items.description: The IDV report element name, e.g., 'face', 'dob', 'name'.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-Document.description:
Result of a document check, indicating how likely or accurate the presented document is a valid ID document.

For resultMap keys, use the keys found in the enum: SupplementaryDataIDVEnumDataDocument.

attachmentIds.description: The IDs of the document images that were analyzed.

front.description: The ID of the front image of the document.

back.description: The ID of the back image of the document.

detectedDocumentCountry.description: The ISO-3166-alpha3 country code of the document as detected.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-Facial-Comparison.description:
Result of a facial comparison check, indicating how likely or accurate the presented face matches the ID document.

For resultMap keys, use the keys found in the enum: SupplementaryDataIDVEnumDataFacialComparison.

comparedDocumentId.description: The document ID of the ID document that was compared.

comparedDocumentAttachmentId.description: The attachment ID of the ID document that was compared.

comparedSelfieId.description: The document ID of the selfie that was compared.

comparedSelfieAttachmentId.description: The attachment ID of the selfie that was compared.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-Facial-Liveness.description:
Result of a facial liveness check, indicating how likely the facial photo or video is of a live person.

For resultMap keys, use the keys found in the enum: SupplementaryDataIDVEnumDataFacialLiveness.

comparedSelfieId.description: The document ID of the selfie that was compared.

comparedSelfieAttachmentId.description: The attachment ID of the selfie that was compared.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-OCR.description:
Result of a document OCR comparison. This object represents the comparison between scanned data (via OCR) and updated or alternately supplied results.

For the resultMap keys, use the keys defined in the enum: SupplementaryDataIDVEnumDataOCR.

scannedDocumentId.description: The documentId of the ID document on which OCR extraction was performed.

scannedAttachmentFrontId.description: The attachmentId of the front image of the ID document used for OCR extraction.

scannedAttachmentBackId.description: The attachmentId of the back image of the ID document used for OCR extraction, if a back image was provided.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-OCR-Comparison-En.description:
Indicates the source of the data used for comparison with the OCR scan results.
The source can be either the original entity data or the updated data extracted from the OCR scan.

Supplementary-Data-IDV-OCR-Comparison.description:
Result of an OCR and updated data comparison. This object represents the comparison between scanned data (via OCR) and updated or alternately supplied results.

When selecting data for comparison, preference is given to the entity details that have been or will be sent to service providers for verification, rather than the updated data provided in the OCR scan.

For the resultMap and mismatchMap keys, use the keys defined in the enum: SupplementaryDataIDVEnumDataOCRComparison.

ocrResultId.description: The proId of the OCR data PRO used for this comparison.

mismatchMap.description:
Map of OCR mismatches between previously entered or expected values and the OCR result.

Actual matches should be recorded in resultMap.

nameId.description: The nameId of the name object used in the comparison.

dobId.description: The dobId of the date of birth object used in the comparison.

Matchlist-Entry-Reason-Code.description: The reason code for the matchlist entry. This code will be translated to a configured description string. Supported codes are 1 to 24 characters long, consisting only of uppercase letters (A-Z), digits (0-9), underscores (_), or hyphens (-), with no spaces or special characters.

Matchlist-Entry-Base.description: Basic details about a matchlist entry, excluding metadata.

entryId.description: Unique identifier for the matchlist entry.

entityId.description: The entity ID from which the attributes of this entry are derived. This is optional and can be used to link the matchlist entry to an entity.

entityType.description: The type of entity from which the attributes of this entry are derived. This is optional and can be used to link the matchlist entry to an entity.

reference.description: Optional reference describing the context of this entry.

reasons.description: The reasons for the matchlist entry. These codes will be translated to configured description strings.

Search-Confidence.description:
Confidence level of the search result, represented as a number between 0 and 1.
A higher value indicates greater confidence in the accuracy of the search result.

Matchlist-Entry-Attribute-Type.description:
Entity attributes eligible for screening.

A matchlist entry may not contain both `ORG_*` and `IND_*` attributes, and they must match the `ENTITY_TYPE` if it is provided.

Supplementary-Data-Matchlist-Attribute.description: Information about a matched attribute within a matched field.

confidence.description: Confidence score for the attribute match.

Supplementary-Data-Matchlist-Field.description: Entity data that resulted in a match at the time of execution.

objectId.description: Unique identifier of the matched object.

Supplementary-Data-Matchlist.description: Each match against a matchlist entry generates a PRO (Process Result Object), and this object describes the details of the matched entry.

Activity-ID.description: Activity ID that identifies an activity within the FrankieOne platform

Session.description: Session details for an activity, this is always scoped to a singular entity.

token.description: A token to identify the specific session for the activity

sourceId.description: The source from where a specific information was sourced from. This is a link to an informationSource object in the informationSources map.

registeredName.description: The registered name of the organization

registeredSubdivision.description: The subdivision that the organization was registered at

registeredCountry.description: The country that the organization was registered at

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the organization in the registry

registrationNumberType.description: The type of the registration number, e.g. ACN, ABN, etc

registrationNumberDescription.description: The description of type of the registration number, e.g. Australian Company Number, Australian Business Number, etc

Party-Detail-Summary.description: A summary of the party details

entityName.description: The name of the entity, use this if the entity type is not clear

Party-Detail.description:
A party describes the details of one of the parties in a given transaction. It can be used to 
describe any participant.

A party can only either be an individual or an organization.

To evaluate a party, you need to provide the details about the party involved by:
* Using an existing entity data: Include the entityId in the party object. The data will be extracted from the entity in the FrankieOne system.
* Filling in the details: Include the specific details within the party object. Data provided here will take precedence over the entity data but will not enrich the entity details in the FrankieOne system.

Activity-Type.description: The different types of activities able to be monitored

Activity-Custom-Attributes.description:
A set of key value pairs with a type provided. Do not store PII data in this field.
Validation:
- minLength: 1
- maxLength: 64
- pattern: '^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9-]*$'

activityAt.description: The timestamp that the activity occurred in UTC ISO8601 format

Event-Type.description: The type of event that has occurred

Event.description: An event represents a non-financial event in the customers platform.

Activity-Event.description:
An activity detailing an event, use for non-transactional activities or user behavior monitoring. 

Examples: User registration, login, profile updates, password resets.

Currency.description: 3-digit ISO 4217 currency code or crypto symbol

Transaction-Method.description: The method of payment used for the transaction

Transaction-Account-Type.description: The type of the account that was used in the financial transaction.

pan.description: The primary account number (PAN) / crypto wallet of the party at the source service

Transaction-Account-ExternalId-Type.description: An Account External ID type, usually associated with a PayID type.

hashedPan.description: The Sha-256 hash of card number (PAN) of the party at the source service

maskedPan.description: The masked card number (PAN) of the party at the source service

route.description: The branch/BIN/BSB identifier to go with the pan

iban.description: The IBAN identifier to go with the pan

swiftCode.description: The Swift code identifier (or BIC - Bank Identifier Code) to go with the pan

externalIdentifier.description: If there is an external identifier associated with this account (e.g. PayID for an NPP transaction), then include that here

Transaction-Type.description: The type of movement of funds

Transaction-Merchant-Industry-Code.description: A merchant industry code and description pair. (e.g. MCC, ANZSIC)

code.description: Short standard code or normalized representation of the information

description.description: The information relevant to the code, could be a more descriptive information

type.description: Determines the type of the industry code.

Transaction-Merchant-Details.description: A merchant reflects details of the merchant owner.

merchantIdentifier.description: The merchant identifier of the merchant owner.

Transaction.description: A transaction represents the details of a deposit or withdrawal of a entity.

amount.description: The amount to be applied to the party

counterpartyAmount.description: The amount to be applied to the party

description.description:
Short description of the payment from the perspective of the
party, or any attached reference details.

transactionIdentifier.description:
A payment identifier supplied by an external party / source to associate with this party in the transaction.
This should be a unique reference for the customer to tie their transaction records to FrankieOne data.

Counter-Party-Detail.description:
A party describes the details of one of the parties in a given transaction (natch). It can be used to 
describe any participant and is differentiated by the paymentRole fulfilled.

You can either provide the raw entity ID as a reference or fill in the details. If an entity ID is provided,
the data will be extracted from the entity in the FrankieOne system. Data provided here will take precedence 
over the entity data but will not enrich the entity details in the FrankieOne system.

Activity-Transaction.description:
An activity detailing a transaction, use for financial activities and asset movements.

Examples: Deposits, withdrawals (fiat or crypto), payments, fund transfers.

Activity-Detail.description: Details of the activity being checked

hesitationPercentileLongTermMemory.description:
The hesitation percentile for fields like address, name, etc which
are associated with long term memory.

hesitationPercentileNonLongTermMemory.description:
The hesitation percentile for fields like amount fields which
are not associated with long term memory.

riskScore.description: Risk score as determine by the device checking service

isRat.description: Was the device user determined to be a rat?

isSupported.description: Was the device supported or not?

isEmulated.description: Was the device determined to be real or emulated?

isRooted.description: Was the device determined to be rooted?

sourceId.description: The source from where a specific information was sourced from. This is a link to an informationSource object in the informationSources map.

trueOs.description: the true OS of the device

firstSeenAt.description: the first time the device was seen in the provider network

Geolocation.description: Geolocation details if it can be determined, typically related to a device during an activity

country.description: The country in alpha 3 ISO-3166-1 standard

IP-Information.description: IP information, typically in relation to a device

asn.description: The ASN of the IP address

connectionType.description: The type of IP connection (if available)

Device.description: Device information associated with an activity, used for submitting device checks using an external service.

createdAt.description: the time the device was created in UTC ISO8601 format

activityRequestId.description: The request ID associated to the activity being submitted

Activity-Result-ID.description: Activity Result ID that identifies a result from an evaluation of an activity

Result-Reference-Type.description: The type of the reference (e.g. url)

name.description: The source of the result (e.g. sardine)

reference.description:
A link or reference to the source of the result. 
The format will depend on the source and the reference type.

Indicator-ID.description: Indicator ID that identifies an indicator from a check on an activity

Rule-ID.description: Rule ID that identifies an instance of a rule within the FrankieOne platform

Supplementary-Data-Activity-AML.description: Provides details of an activity Anti-Money Laundering (AML) result.

Supplementary-Data-Activity-Fraud.description: Defines the details of an activity fraud result.

Supplementary-Data-Activity-Event.description: Defines the details of an activity device result.

Session-Data.description: Session data for an activity, this is always scoped to a singular entity.

sessionId.description: A FrankieOne ID for the session

createdAt.description: the time the session was created in UTC ISO8601 format

expiresAt.description: the time the session expires in UTC ISO8601 format

Supplementary-Data-Fraud-Device-Data.description: Provides details of a single fraud check for device and related device data.

Supplementary-Data-Fraud-Device.description: Provides details of a single device fraud check.

Supplementary-Data-Fraud-Email-Address.description: Defines the details of a single email fraud check.

Supplementary-Data-Fraud-IP-Address-Data.description: Defines the details of a single fraud check for IP address related data.

Supplementary-Data-Fraud-IP-Address.description: Defines the details of a single IP address fraud check.

Supplementary-Data-Fraud-Phone-Number.description: Defines the details of a single phone number fraud check.

code.description: The error code associated with the process result.

location.description: The location or context where the error occurred.

Process-Result-System-StatusEnum.description:
If there has been an additional system status applied to the process.
- VALID: The process result is valid and has not been marked for any special handling.
- EXPIRED: The process result has expired and is no longer valid.
- STALE: The process result is considered stale, meaning it may be outdated but not necessarily invalid.
- MARKED_INVALID: The process result has been explicitly marked as invalid.
- MARKED_IGNORE: The process result has been marked to be ignored, meaning it should not be considered in further processing.

Process-Result-Manual-StatusEnum-AML.description:
The manual status that the AML process result should be set to after the results have been reviewed.
- FALSE_POSITIVE: The result is determined to be a false positive, but you do not necessarily want to resolve it.
- TRUE_POSITIVE_ACCEPT: The result is determined to be a true positive and you want to resolve it. "Accept" infers you want to accept the activity.
- TRUE_POSITIVE: The result is determined to be a true positive, but you do not necessarily want to resolve it.
- TRUE_POSITIVE_REJECT: The result is determined to be a true positive and you want to resolve it. "Reject" infers you want to reject the activity.
- UNKNOWN: The result is determined to be unknown, but you do not necessarily want to resolve it.
- UNKNOWN_ACCEPT: The result is determined to be unknown and you want to resolve it. "Accept" infers you want to accept the activity.
- UNKNOWN_REJECT: The result is determined to be unknown and you want to resolve it. "Reject" infers you want to reject the activity.

Process-Result-Manual-StatusEnum-KYC.description:
Any manual status set after the results have been reviewed.
- PASS: When the result is determined to be a pass and no further action is needed.
- FAIL: When the result is determined to be a fail and no further action is needed.

Process-Result-Manual-StatusEnum-IDV.description:
Any manual status set after the results have been reviewed.
- CLEAR: When the result is determined to be clear and no further action is needed.
- REJECTED: When the result is determined to be rejected and no further action is needed.

Process-Result-Manual-StatusEnum-Duplica.description:
Manual review status options for duplicate entity resolution. Used to indicate the outcome of a manual duplicate check between an existing entity (A) and an incoming entity (B):
- FALSE_POSITIVE: Entities are not duplicates. Both Entity A and Entity B are distinct and should be retained as separate records.
- TRUE_POSITIVE_ACCEPT: Entities are duplicates. Keep the incoming entity (Entity B) as the primary record and mark the existing entity (Entity A) as the duplicate. Use when the incoming record is more accurate or complete.
- TRUE_POSITIVE_REJECT: Entities are duplicates. Keep the existing entity (Entity A) as the primary record and mark the incoming entity (Entity B) as the duplicate. Use when the existing record is more trusted or complete.

Process-Result-Manual-StatusEnum-Matchli.description:
Any manual status set after the results have been reviewed.
- FALSE_POSITIVE: The result is determined to be a false positive, but you do not necessarily want to resolve it.
- TRUE_POSITIVE_REJECT: The result is determined to be a true positive and you want to resolve it. "Reject" infers you want to reject the activity.

Process-Result-Manual-StatusEnum-Support.description:
Any manual status set after the results have been reviewed.
- APPROVED: When the document has been reviewed and is acceptable.
- REJECTED: When the document has been reviewed and is deemed to be not acceptable.
- NEEDS_ATTENTION: When the document has been reviewed and requires further attention.

Process-Result-StateEnum.description: Denotes the final disposition of this element's check result

value.description: Supplier/service provided value that Frankie will plug into the risk engine to determine a score.

stepResultId.description: Unique identifier for this step result.

workflowExecutionId.description: Identifier of the associated workflow execution.

stepName.description: The name of the step, in SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE.

requestId.description: Identifier of the request associated with this step.

objectType.description: Type of the primary object checked in this step.

objectId.description: Identifier of the object checked in this step.

schemaVersion.description: Version of the schema used for this step.

startedAt.description: Date and time when this step started.

endedAt.description: Date and time when this step ended.

serviceProviders.description: List of service providers involved in this step.

errors.description: List of errors encountered during this step.

risk.description: Risk assessment result for this step.

notes.description: Additional notes or custom attributes for this step.

processResults.description: List of process result objects for this step.

createdAt.description: Date and time when this step result was created.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when this step result was last updated.

updatedBy.description: Identifier of the user or system that last updated this step result.

workflowExecutionId.description: Unique identifier for the workflow execution.

requestId.description: Identifier of the request that initiated the workflow.

entityId.description: Identifier of the entity being processed.

entityType.description: Type of the entity being processed.

schemaVersion.description: Version of the schema used for this workflow execution.

startedAt.description: Date and time when the workflow execution started.

endedAt.description: Date and time when the workflow execution ended.

serviceProfileId.description: Identifier of the service profile used.

endWorkflowId.description: Identifier of the workflow that ended.

endWorkflowName.description: Name of the workflow that ended.

workflowStepResults.description: List of results for each workflow step.

result.description: Final result of the workflow execution.

workflowExecutionState.description: Current state of the workflow execution.

errors.description: List of errors encountered during workflow execution.

notes.description: Additional notes or custom attributes related to the workflow execution.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the workflow execution record was created.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when the workflow execution record was last updated.

updatedBy.description: Identifier of the user or system that last updated the workflow execution record.

Workflow-Execution-ID.description: The execution ID (formerly known as Check ID) representing a single workflow execution instance.

List-Operation-Meta.description: Meta information about the request and response returned during a list operation.

page.description: The current page number of the request.

total.description: The total number of items found for the search criteria.

limit.description: The limit applied to this response.

count.description: The number of items returned in this response.

sort.description: The sort order applied to the items in the response.

Workflow-Execution-State.description:
Indicates the current state of this workflow execution.
Refer to the documentation for a full description of each possible workflow execution state.

Service-Profile-State-Patch.description: Current state of the Service Profile. This is a restricted set that can be changed externally.

assignee.description: The name of the officer assigned to approve this profile

reviewer.description: The name of the officer assigned to review this profile

Manual-KYC.description: Provides a list of approved identity documents used in the manual KYC (mKYC) verification of this individual. The approved documents must be present on the entity for the mKYC process to be successful.

approvedBy.description: The person or system who approved the mKYC verification process.

approvedDocuments.description: The identity documents that were approved as part of the mKYC verification process.

Process-Result-Manual-StatusEnum-Fraud.description:
The status that the fraud process result should be set to after the results have been reviewed.
- FALSE_POSITIVE: When the result is determined to be false positive and it is an acceptable risk.
- TRUE_POSITIVE_ACCEPT: When the result is determined to be true positive and it is an acceptable risk.
- TRUE_POSITIVE_REJECT: When the result is determined to be true positive and it is an unacceptable risk.

processResults.description: The process result IDs to update. These are the PROs created when a fraud has been found.

Consent-Type-Param.description: The type of consent provided by an entity.

Search-Type.description:
Specifies the type of search to perform.

- "EXACT": Returns only results that exactly match the search term.
- "FUZZY": Returns results that are similar to the search term.

Search-Field.description:
List of fields that can be searched.

  - "NAME": Searches all name parts of the profile.
  - "GIVEN_NAME": Searches the given name of the individual linked to the profile.
  - "FAMILY_NAME": Searches the family name of the individual linked to the profile.
  - "MIDDLE_NAME": Searches the middle name of the individual linked to the profile.
  - "DISPLAY_NAME": Searches the preferred display name. By default, this is the combined given, middle, and family names.
  - "OTHER_NAME": Searches other names of the individual linked to the profile.
  - "EXTERNAL_REFERENCE": Searches the external reference of the entity linked to the profile.
  - "REGISTERED_NAME": Searches the registered names of the organization linked to the profile.
  - "ALTERNATE_NAME": Searches the alternate (other than registered) names of the organization linked to the profile.
  - "REGISTRATION_NUMBER": Searches the registration numbers of the organization linked to the profile.

Planned for future implementation:
  - "ADDRESS": Searches the address of the entity linked to the profile.
  - "EMAIL_ADDRESS": Searches the email address of the entity linked to the profile.
  - "PHONE_NUMBER": Searches the phone number of the entity linked to the profile.
  - "DOCUMENT_IDENTIFIER": Searches primary and secondary identifiers in documents linked to the profile.

If an individual field type is specified and the search is limited to organizations, or vice versa, then nothing
will be found for those fields. The "NAME" and "EXTERNAL_REFERENCE" field types will search both individuals and
organziations, if both are requested in the search, which is the default.

term.description: The value to search for in profiles. This term will be matched against the specified field.

terms.description: List of search terms to be used as criteria.

Search-Filter-Entity-Type.description: The type of entity within Frankie to filter on. This can be "INDIVIDUAL" or "ORGANIZATION".

Status-Override-Type-Filter.description:
Filter on the status override type. Accepted values are:

- ONLY_OVERRIDDEN: Returns only profiles with manually overridden statuses.
- EXCLUDE_OVERRIDDEN: Excludes profiles with manually overridden statuses.
- ALL: Returns both profiles with and without manually overridden statuses.

status.description: List of workflowStatus value that the Service Profiles will be filter with

Workflow-Execution-ScopeEnum.description:
Determines how workflow status and name filters are applied:
  - LAST: Applies filters only to the most recent workflow execution.
  - ANY: Searches across all workflow executions.

entityIds.description: Entity IDs to filter the Service Profiles by.

entityTypes.description:
Limit result to entities of the given types. By default all types are considered.
Accepted values are:
  - INDIVIDUAL
  - ORGANIZATION

createdAtBefore.description: Filter Service Profiles created on or before this date and time (inclusive).

createdAtAfter.description: Filter Service Profiles created on or after this date and time (inclusive).

updatedAtAfter.description: Filter Service Profiles updated on or after this date and time (inclusive).

updatedAtBefore.description: Filter Service Profiles updated on or before this date and time (inclusive).

states.description: List of Service Profile state values to filter Service Profiles.

workflowNames.description: Filter by workflow execution summary workflow names.

workflowExecutionStatuses.description:
Filter by combinations of workflowStatus and statusOverrideType.
If this filter is used, the deprecated statusOverrideType and workflowStatuses filters are ignored.

statusOverrideType.description:
Filter by status override type. Accepted values are:
  - ONLY_OVERRIDDEN: Returns only profiles with manually overridden statuses.
  - EXCLUDE_OVERRIDDEN: Excludes profiles with manually overridden statuses.
  - ALL: Returns both profiles with and without manually overridden statuses.
If not provided, the default behavior is ALL.

workflowStatuses.description: List of workflowStatus values to filter Service Profiles.

issueCategories.description: List of issue categories to filter Service Profiles.

issueSeverities.description: List of issue severities to filter Service Profiles.

riskLevels.description: Filter by workflow execution summary risk levels. If workflow name is not provided, all execution summaries are searched.

items.description:
Filter for issues. Should match categories being filtered for. For each category, this provides the actual issue.
VERIFY:
  NOT_FOUND (was 404)
  BAD_DATA_NAME
  BAD_DATA_DOB
  BAD_DATA_ADDRESS
  BAD_DATA_ID
  BAD_DATA_EMAIL
  BAD_DATA_MOBILE
DECEASED:
  DECEASED
EXPIRY:
  REQUIRES_KYC
  REQUIRES_IDV
  REQUIRES_AML
INFORMATIONAL:
  CREDIT_HEADER
AML:
  PEP
  SANCTION

entity.description: This field is deprecated and will be removed in the future version. Please use entityId instead.

Subscription-Status.description:
Indicates the current status of the subscription.

  - `ENABLED`: The subscription is active and operational.
  - `DISABLED`: The subscription is inactive and not operational.

entity_patch_monitoring_subscriptions_de.description: The subscription details for monitoring, this object is returned per monitoring type

serviceName.description: The name of service associated the service profile

serviceProfileId.description: The ID of the service profile

enabledAt.description: The date and time when the subscription was last enabled

enabledRequestId.description: The request id when the subscription was last enabled

enabledBy.description: The username of last user who enabled the subscription

disabledAt.description: The date and time when the subscription was last disabled

disabledRequestId.description: The request id when the subscription was last disabled

disabledBy.description: The username of last user who disabled the subscription

workflows.description: The workflows that will be executed by the type for the service profile

entity_patch_monitoring_subscriptions_am.description: The subscription details for AML monitoring

subscriptions.description: The list of AML monitoring subscriptions

providers.description: The providers that will be affected by the subscription

IDV-Token-Request.description: IDV Token Request, queries the IDV provider for a token to be used with their sdk. If there is an existing token for this given entity that isn't expired, that will be returned instead of a new token.

applicantId.description: ID of the applicant/individual in the IDV provider's system. Specify this if resuming/continuing an IDV check

applicationId.description: Reference or name of the application running this IDV check. Specify this if running this check embedded in a application rather than a web page.

country.description: Country code to check for. Must be a ISO-3166 alpha-3 code entry. Only for use with providers that can restrict to a single country.

documentType.description: Document type that will be used for the check. Can be one of DRIVERS_LICENCE, PASSPORT, NATIONAL_ID. . Only for use with providers that can restrict to a single document type.

referrer.description: If this is for a web SDK, then you need to supply the referrer domain so that the token can be validated by the IDV service

relayState.description: State from start of flow that should be relayed through the process via any redirects.

provider.description: What provider to use for the IDV check. This is the name of the provider as configured in the system. If not provided the default provider will be used.

products.description: What product(s) for the provider to use for the IDV check. If not provided the default product for a provider will be used.

IDV-Token-Response.description: IDV Token Response, contains the token and it's expiry, and any vendor specific parameters.

applicantId.description: The ID of the applicant attached to this check.

country.description: Country code to check for. Must be a ISO-3166 alpha-3 code entry.

documentType.description: Document type that will be used for the check.

provider.description: Underlying provider, used for selecting the correct SDK if not using SmartUI.

smsSent.description: Has a sms to the user already been sent as part of the token request

token.description: Tokens are only valid for a limited time.

tokenExpiry.description: The time at which the provided token will expire.

vendorParameters.description: Vendor specific parameters, used for passing through additional parameters from the vendor to instantiate the SDK.

IDV-OCR-Request.description: OCR request, used to submit an image of an identity document for OCR processing. The image can be uploaded via a vendor SDK after calling get IDV token, or can be submitted directly as a fileData.

digital.description: Is this a digital version of the id, eg Digital Driver Licence screenshot. If not provided assumed to be false.

documentId.description: document id if known that the scan data should be attached to

token.description: if the image was captured via a provder SDK, pass through the token instead of the fileData

status.description:
Status of the OCR process. Status can be one of:
- AWAITING_OCR_RESULTS_PROVIDER_OFFLINE - the provider is offline and the OCR results are not available
- AWAITING_DOCUMENT_UPLOAD_INVALID_TYPE  - the document type is not supported, mostly only passport, driving license and national id are supported but this is provider specific
- WAITING_DOCUMENT_UPLOAD_FAILED_OCR - the document upload failed to the provider
- AWAITING_DOCUMENT_OCR - the document is being processed by the provider still and it awaiting results
- DOCUMENT_INVALID_EXCEEDED_SIZE_LIMIT - the document is too large to be processed
- DOCUMENT_INVALID_INCORRECT_FILE_FORMAT - the document is not a supported file format, mostly only jpeg and png are supported but this is provider specific
- AWAITING_DOCUMENT_UPLOAD_BACK - the back of the document needs to be uploaded
- AWAITING_DOCUMENT_UPLOAD_FRONT - the front of the document needs to be upload
- COMPLETE_OCR - document OCR is valid and completed

IDV-InitProcess-Request.description: Init IDV Process Request, used after capture of IDV data from a customer, including photos/videos of the face and ID. For providers that support it, this will synchronously report all report results from the provider. For providers that do not support synchronous reporting, this will request the reports and return a request id and status. The status can be polled for the final result or sent via webhook. Body parameters are optional, if they are not sent, then the latest token for the entity is used.

providerReferenceId.description: provider reference Id if known. May be referred to as checkId or interviewId in vendor specific document

token.description: if no check id has yet been created for this idv check, pass through the token instead

IDV-InitProcess-Response.description: Init Process Response, used after retrieval of IDV reports from a provider. For providers that support it, this will synchronously report all report results from the provider. For providers that do not support synchronous reporting, this will request the reports and return a request id and status. The status can be polled for the final result or sent via webhook

status.description:
Status of the process. Status can be one of:
- IN_PROGRESS - the provider has been sent the request and is currently still processing the result
- CHECK_PROCESSING_DOWNLOAD_FAIL  - the provider has been sent the request and is currently still processing the result, there was an issue downloading the images that will be retried later automatically
- WAITING_SELFIE_UPLOAD - the selfie has not been uploaded yet by the applicant, still awaiting applicant action
- CHECK_PROCESSING - the provider has been sent the request and is currently still processing the result
- DOCUMENT_INVALID_EXCEEDED_SIZE_LIMIT - the document is too large to be processed
- DOCUMENT_INVALID_INCORRECT_FILE_FORMAT - the document is not a supported file format, mostly only jpeg and png are supported but this is provider specific
- PROVIDER_OFFLINE - the provider is not available for processing the request
- COMPLETE - process is valid and completed

workflowExecutionId.description: If a workflow was run as part of the processing, this is the workflow execution id

IDV-HostedUrl-Request-Document.description: The document to be requested from the customer for this onesdk session

IDV-HostedUrl-Request-Partial-Document.description: The partial document to be requested from the customer for this onesdk session

documents.description: List of documents that are partial to issue the JWT Token

IDV-HostedUrl-Request.description: Hosted OneSDK URL Request, used to request a hosted OneSDK URL with entity specific token for a customer to use a hosted OneSDK session to do an action. Examples of actions that may be done is to complete their onboarding process or to re-attempt IDV checks.  If sendSMS is true and a phone number is supplied, an SMS will be sent to the phone number with the generated URL.

applicationRef.description: Reference or name of the application running this IDV check. Specify this if running this check embedded in a application rather than a web page.

channelRef.description: channel this application is being submitted through, eg WEB, MOBILE

consent.description: Has user consented for IDV check. If not supplied or is false, consent will need to be submitted via provider SDK.

customerRef.description: external customer reference for this entity. If supplied and an entity id not, we will search for an entity with this customer ref. If not found, a new entity will be created with this customer ref.

entityId.description: Unique FrankieOne identifier for an entity if already created

errorRedirectURL.description: if provider sdk fails, redirect to this url

oneSDKFlowId.description: Flow id to use for OneSDK, to determine what data needs to be captured from the user, for example :"idv" or "ocr_only"

phoneNumber.description: phone code can be included with phone number or split out

recipientName.description: if supplied will be used as the recipient name for the SMS

sendSMS.description: if true, will send an SMS to the phone number supplied

successRedirectURL.description: url to redirect to on success

requestedDocuments.description: List of documents that are requested from customer for onesdk session

optionalDocuments.description: List of documents that are optional from customer for onesdk session

partialDocuments.description: List of documents that are partial from customer for onesdk session

IDV-HostedUrl-Response.description: Onboarding URL Response, contains the url for onboarding as well as the expiry. Each call to this endpoint will generate a new URL with a new expiry.

status.description: Status of the response for generating the onboarding URL and optionally sending via SMS.

url.description: URL to redirect the user to for onboarding, will point to a page where the user can complete their onboarding or IDV check.

urlExpiry.description: The time at which the provided URL will expire according to configuration. Can not be set longer than 7 days
